name: Olumo Rock
description: A majestic granite outcrop with historical significance. It served as a fortress for the Egba people during intertribal wars. Visitors can explore natural caves, ancient carvings, and climb to the summit for panoramic city views.

name: Zuma Rock
location: Along Abuja-Kaduna Road, Madalla, Niger State (near Abuja)
description: An iconic monolith often called the 'Gateway to Abuja.' The rock features a natural face-like carving and is steeped in local legend. It's a sacred site and a national symbol found on the 100 naira note.

name: Erin Ijesha Waterfalls (Olumirin Waterfalls)
location: Erin Ijesha, Oriade LGA, Osun State
description: A beautiful seven-step waterfall tucked in a lush rainforest. It's ideal for hiking and nature photography. Each level reveals a different perspective of the cascading water.

name: Obudu Mountain Resort
description: A high-altitude resort in the Sankwala Mountains. Known for its cool climate, cable cars, mountain lodges, and canopy walkway. Great for family vacations, honeymoons, and nature retreats.

name: Yankari National Park
location: Main Entrance, Yankari Game Reserve, Bauchi State
description: Nigeria's top wildlife safari destination. Home to elephants, baboons, hippos, and lions. Also features the Wikki Warm Spring, where visitors can swim in naturally heated water.

name: Nike Art Gallery
location: No. 2 Elegushi Road, Lekki, Lagos State
description: One of the largest art galleries in West Africa with a vast collection of Nigerian paintings, textiles, sculptures, and crafts. Founded by renowned artist Nike Davies-Okundaye. Entry is free, and art is available for purchase.

name: Awhum Waterfall and Cave
location: Awhum Monastery, Udi LGA, Enugu State
description: A mystical site with a warm waterfall and cave believed to have healing and spiritual powers. Operated by a Catholic monastery, making it a peaceful destination for prayer and retreat.

name: Lekki Conservation Centre
location: KM 19 Lekki-Epe Expressway, Lekki Peninsula, Lagos State
description: A 78-hectare nature reserve known for its lush greenery and the longest canopy walkway in Africa. Offers sightings of monkeys, peacocks, and rare birds. Ideal for eco-tourism and school excursions.
